medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ and RLQ abdominal pain and nausea
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 24 hours prior to presentation, starting around the previous evening. They include abdominal pain in the right upper and lower quadrants as well as nausea. The patient reported a continuous presence of abdominal pain, which persisted after being sent back to the nursing home.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Quadriplegia/expressive aphasia secondary to MVC/TBI years ago, right DVT/PE on coumadin, depression, anxiety, GERD, left hip fracture.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lives in a nursing home since TBI approximately years ago.
